list_definition.definition: (of people or their behaviour/behavior, statements etc) truthful; not cheating, stealing etc
(of a person’s appearance) suggesting that he is honest
(of wealth etc) not gained by cheating, stealing etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She was just trying to earn an honest living.

list_ex_of_english: Truth telling is an important principle of medical ethics because honest communication shows respect, it promotes an effective therapeutic relationship, and it preserves trust.
Lastly, sincerity (being honest, speaking from the heart, etc.) is a positive trait that rock critics commonly cite.

This awkward piece, gangling and almost painfully honest in its criticism, was, so to speak, 'disappeared'.
And yet, if the moderates were morally narrow and shortsighted, they were also morally honest.
This might not be the archaeology that state authorities love to fund; it is too honest for that.
Under certain conditions, however, an attribute's link with heritable fitness can remain honest and stable.
Coupled with the volume's empirical breadth, this cautious optimism helps make the authors' arguments both honest and valuable.
